1027                    "}";
1028    public static final String fragmentShaderHSLARoundTrip =
1029            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1030                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1031                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1032                    "#else\n" +
1033                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1034                    "#endif\n" +
1035                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1036                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1037                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1038                    partialCodeHSL +
1039                    "\n" +
1040                    "void main()\n" +
1041                    "{\n" +
1042                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1043                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1044                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1045                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1046                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1047                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1048                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1049                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1050                    "   tgt = hsl2rgb(rgb2hsl(tgt));\n" +
1051                    "   gl_FragColor = tgt * v_color;\n" +
1052                    "}";
1053    /**
1054     * Generally a lower-quality hue rotation than {@link #fragmentShaderHSLC}; this is here as a work in progress.
1055     * <br>
1056     * You can generate HSLC colors using methods like {@link FloatColors#rgb2hsl(float, float, float, float)}.
1057     * <br>
1058     * Meant to be used with {@link #vertexShaderHSLC}, which sets {@code varying float v_lightFix} so
1059     * contrast can use it.
1060     * <br>
1061     * EXPERIMENTAL. Meant more for reading and editing than serious usage.
1062     */
1063    public static final String fragmentShaderHSLC2 = 
1064                    "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1065                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1066                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1067                    "#else\n" +
1068                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1069                    "#endif\n" +
1070                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1071                    "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
1072                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1073                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1074                            partialCodeHSL +
1075                    "void main()\n" +
1076                    "{\n" +
1077                    "    float hue = (v_color.x - 0.5);\n" +
1078                    "    float saturation = v_color.y * 2.0;\n" +
1079                    "    float brightness = v_color.z - 0.5;\n" +
1080                    "    vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1081                    "    tgt = rgb2hsl(tgt);\n" +
1082                    "    tgt.r = fract(tgt.r + hue);\n" +
1083                    "    tgt = hsl2rgb(tgt);\n" +
1084                    "    tgt.rgb = vec3(\n" +
1085                    "     (0.5 * pow(dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(0.375, 0.5, 0.125)), v_color.w) * v_lightFix + brightness),\n" + // lightness
1086                    "     ((tgt.r - tgt.b) * saturation),\n" + // warmth
1087                    "     ((tgt.g - tgt.b) * saturation));\n" + // mildness
1088                    "    gl_FragColor = clamp(vec4(\n" +
1089                    "     dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(1.0, 0.625, -0.5)),\n" + // back to red
1090                    "     dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(1.0, -0.375, 0.5)),\n" + // back to green
1091                    "     dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(1.0, -0.375, -0.5)),\n" + // back to blue
1092                    "     tgt.a), 0.0, 1.0);\n" + // keep alpha, then clamp
1093                    "}";
1094    /**
1095     * Cycles lightness in a psychedelic way as hue and lightness change; not a general-purpose usage.
1096     * <br>
1097     * You can generate HSLC colors using methods like {@link FloatColors#rgb2hsl(float, float, float, float)}.
1098     * <br>
1099     * Meant to be used with {@link #vertexShaderHSLC}, which sets {@code varying float v_lightFix} so
1100     * contrast can use it.
1101     * <br>
1102     * EXPERIMENTAL. Meant more for reading and editing than serious usage.
1103     */
1104    public static final String fragmentShaderHSLC3 =
1105            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1106                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1107                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1108                    "#else\n" +
1109                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1110                    "#endif\n" +
1111                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1112                    "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
1113                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1114                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1115                    partialHueRodrigues +
1116                    "void main()\n" +
1117                    "{\n" +
1118                    "    float hue = 6.2831853 * (v_color.x - 0.5);\n" +
1119                    "    float saturation = v_color.y * 2.0;\n" +
1120                    "    float brightness = v_color.z - 0.5;\n" +
1121                    "    vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1122                    "    tgt.rgb = applyHue(tgt.rgb, hue);\n" +
1123                    "    tgt.rgb = vec3(\n" +
1124                    "     (0.5 * pow(dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(0.375, 0.5, 0.125)), v_color.w) * v_lightFix),\n" + // lightness
1125                    "     ((tgt.r - tgt.b) * saturation),\n" + // warmth
1126                    "     ((tgt.g - tgt.b) * saturation));\n" + // mildness
1127                    "    tgt.r = sin((tgt.r + brightness) * 6.2831853) * 0.5 + 0.5;\n" +
1128                    "    gl_FragColor = clamp(vec4(\n" +
1129                    "     dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(1.0, 0.625, -0.5)),\n" + // back to red
1130                    "     dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(1.0, -0.375, 0.5)),\n" + // back to green
1131                    "     dot(tgt.rgb, vec3(1.0, -0.375, -0.5)),\n" + // back to blue
1132                    "     tgt.a), 0.0, 1.0);\n" + // keep alpha, then clamp
1133                    "}";
1134    /**
1135     * Cycles hue, but not lightness; otherwise this is like {@link #fragmentShaderHSLC3} without contrast, and keeping
1136     * alpha intact. Internally, this uses Sam Hocevar's RGB/HSL conversion instead of Andrey-Postelzhuk's HSLC code.
1137     * <br>
1138     * You can generate HSLA colors using methods like {@link FloatColors#rgb2hsl(float, float, float, float)}.
1139     * <br>
1140     * Expects the vertex shader to be {@link #vertexShader}, not the HSLC variant.
1141     * <br>
1142     * EXPERIMENTAL. Meant more for reading and editing than serious usage.
1143     */
1144    public static final String fragmentShaderHSL4 =
1145            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1146                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1147                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1148                    "#else\n" +
1149                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1150                    "#endif\n" +
1151                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1152                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1153                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1154                    partialCodeHSL +
1155                    "void main()\n" +
1156                    "{\n" +
1157                    "    float hue = v_color.x - 0.5;\n" +
1158                    "    float saturation = v_color.y * 2.0;\n" +
1159                    "    float brightness = v_color.z - 0.5;\n" +
1160                    "    vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1161                    "    tgt = rgb2hsl(tgt);\n" +
1162                    "    tgt.x = fract(tgt.x + hue);\n" +
1163                    "    tgt.y = clamp(tgt.y * saturation, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1164                    "    tgt.z = clamp(brightness + tgt.z, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1165                    "    gl_FragColor = hsl2rgb(tgt);\n" +
1166                    "}";
1167
1168    /**
1169     * One of the more useful HSL shaders here, this takes a batch color as hue, saturation, lightness, and power,
1170     * with hue as a target hue and power used to determine how much of the target color should be used. There is no
1171     * neutral value for hue, saturation, or lightness, but if power is 0, then the source color will be used
1172     * exactly. On the other hand, if power is 1.0, then all pixels will be the target color. Hue is specified from
1173     * 0.0 to 1.0, with 0.0 as red, about 0.3 as green, about 0.6 as blue, etc. Saturation is specified from 0.0 to 1.0,
1174     * with 0.0 as grayscale and 1.0 as a fully-saturated target color. Lightness is specified from 0.0 to 1.0, with 0.0
1175     * as black, the 0.3 to 0.7 range as most colors, and 1.0 white; saturation is clamped to a smaller value as
1176     * lightness moves away from 0.5 (toward black or white).
1177     * <br>
1178     * Expects the vertex shader to be {@link #vertexShader}, not the HSLC variant.
1179     * <br>
1180     * You can generate HSL(P) colors using methods like {@link FloatColors#rgb2hsl(float, float, float, float)}.
1181     */
1182    public static final String fragmentShaderHSLP =
1183            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1184                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1185                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1186                    "#else\n" +
1187                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1188                    "#endif\n" +
1189                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1190                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1191                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1192                    partialCodeHSL +
1193                    "void main()\n" +
1194                    "{\n" +
1195                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1196                    "   vec4 hsl = rgb2hsl(tgt);\n" +
1197                    "   hsl.x *= 6.2831853;\n" +
1198                    "   hsl.xy = vec2(cos(hsl.x), sin(hsl.x)) * hsl.y;\n" +
1199                    "   vec3 tint = vec3(cos(v_color.x * 6.2831853) * v_color.y, sin(v_color.x * 6.2831853) * v_color.y * 2.0, v_color.z);\n" +
1200                    "   hsl.xyz = mix(hsl.xyz, tint, v_color.w);\n" +
1201                    "   hsl.xy = vec2(fract(atan(hsl.y, hsl.x) / 6.2831853), length(hsl.xy));\n" +
1202                    "   gl_FragColor = hsl2rgb(hsl);\n" +
1203                    "}";
1204
1205    /**
1206     * This is supposed to look for RGBA colors that are similar to {@code search}, and if it finds
1207     * one, to replace it with {@code replace} (also an RGBA color). It isn't great at the searching part.
1208     * <br>
1209     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1210     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1211     * <br>
1212     * EXPERIMENTAL. Meant more for reading and editing than serious usage.
1213     */
1214    public static final String fragmentShaderReplacement = 
1215                    "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1216                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1217                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1218                    "#else\n" +
1219                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1220                    "#endif\n" +
1221                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1222                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1223                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1224                    "uniform vec4 u_search;\n" +
1225                    "uniform vec4 u_replace;\n" +
1226                    "void main()\n" +
1227                    "{\n" +
1228                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1229                    "   float curve = smoothstep(0.0, 1.0, 1.25 - distance(tgt.rgb, u_search.rgb) * 2.0);\n" +
1230                    "   gl_FragColor = vec4(mix(tgt.rgb, u_replace.rgb, curve), tgt.a) * v_color;\n" +
1231                    "}";
1232    /**
1233     * A drop-in replacement for the default fragment shader that eliminates lightness differences in the output colors.
1234     * Specifically, it does the normal SpriteBatch shader's step with the multiplicative batch color, converts to IPT,
1235     * sets intensity to 0.5, shrinks the P and T components so the color is less saturated, and then converts back to
1236     * an RGBA color. Even though this uses IPT internally, it expects the batch color to be normal RGBA.
1237     * <br>
1238     * Editing this shader is strongly encouraged to fit your needs!
1239     * <br>
1240     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1241     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1242     * <br>
1243     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1244     * @see #fragmentShaderConfigurableContrast a per-sprite-configurable version of this
1245     */
1246    public static String fragmentShaderFlatLightness =
1247  "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1248  "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1249  "precision mediump float;\n" +
1250  "#else\n" +
1251  "#define LOWP \n" +
1252  "#endif\n" +
1253  "#define TARGET_LIGHTNESS 0.5 \n" +
1254  "#define SATURATION_CHANGE 1.0 \n" +
1255  "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1256  "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1257  "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1258  "void main()\n" +
1259  "{\n" +
1260  "    vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1261  "    vec3 ipt = (mat3(0.189786, 0.669665 , 0.286498, 0.576951, -0.73741 , 0.655205, 0.233221, 0.0681367, -0.941748)\n" +
1262  "         * (tgt.rgb * v_color.rgb));\n" +
1263  "    ipt.x = TARGET_LIGHTNESS;\n" + // change to desired lightness or pass in a lightness as a uniform
1264  "//    ipt.x = (ipt.x - 0.5) * 0.25 + TARGET_LIGHTNESS;\n" + // an alternative way that preserves a tiny bit of original lightness
1265  "    ipt.yz *= SATURATION_CHANGE;\n" + // multiplies saturation by SATURATION_CHANGE, which may be more or less than 1.0
1266  "    vec3 back = clamp(mat3(0.999779, 1.00015, 0.999769, 1.07094, -0.377744, 0.0629496, 0.324891, 0.220439, -0.809638) * ipt, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1267  "    gl_FragColor = vec4(back, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1268  "}";
1269    /**
1270     * A specialized shader that can reduce lightness differences in the output colors, saturate/desaturate them, and
1271     * can be configured to use some of the existing lightness in the image to add to a main flat lightness.
1272     * Specifically, it takes the fragment color (typically a pixel in a texture), converts to IPT, does a calculation
1273     * involving the intensity of the fragment color where the batch color's blue channel affects how much that
1274     * intensity is used, adds the red channel of the batch color, multiplies the P and T components by the green
1275     * channel times 2.0 to saturate or desaturate, and then converts back to an RGBA color. The neutral value for this
1276     * is the RGBA color 0.5, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0 . A typical usage to achieve a fog effect would be to raise lightness (r),
1277     * slightly reduce saturation (g), sharply flatten the original texture's lightness (b), and leave alpha alone (a):
1278     * 0.7, 0.4, 0.2, 1.0 .
1279     * <br>
1280     * This doesn't use a standard type of color; you should use something like
1281     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)} to set the channels in
1282     * the specific way this uses them.
1283     * <br>
1284     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1285     * @see #fragmentShaderFlatLightness if you only need one contrast setting and still want to set color tints
1286     */
1287    public static String fragmentShaderConfigurableContrast =
1288            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1289                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1290                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1291                    "#else\n" +
1292                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1293                    "#endif\n" +
1294                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1295                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1296                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1297                    "void main()\n" +
1298                    "{\n" +
1299                    "    vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1300                    "    vec3 ipt = (mat3(0.189786, 0.669665 , 0.286498, 0.576951, -0.73741 , 0.655205, 0.233221, 0.0681367, -0.941748)\n" +
1301                    "         * tgt.rgb);\n" +
1302                    "    ipt.x = (ipt.x - 0.5) * v_color.b + v_color.r;\n" + // preserves some lightness based on b, sets main lightness with r
1303                    "    ipt.yz *= v_color.g * 2.0;\n" + // the green channel affects saturation; if it's 0.5 it won't change saturation.
1304                    "    vec3 back = clamp(mat3(0.999779, 1.00015, 0.999769, 1.07094, -0.377744, 0.0629496, 0.324891, 0.220439, -0.809638) * ipt, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1305                    "    gl_FragColor = vec4(back, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1306                    "}";
1307
1308    /**
1309     * A day/night cycle shader that can be used without any other parts of this library. This only needs setting the
1310     * uniform {@code u_timeOfDay} to any float; the rate at which you change this float affects how fast the day/night
1311     * cycle occurs. This is meant to be used with {@link #fragmentShaderDayNight}. Together, they make the color
1312     * adjustment go from bluish and dark at night, to purplish at dawn, to orange/yellow and bright at mid-day, toward
1313     * red at dusk, and then back to bluish at night. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1314     * <br>
1315     * Editing this shader is strongly encouraged to fit your needs! The time-based variables st, ct, and dd can all be
1316     * adjusted to increase or decrease the strength of the effect, and their effects can also be adjusted upon v_color
1317     * and v_tweak.
1318     * <br>
1319     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1320     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1321     */
1322    public static String vertexShaderDayNight = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1323            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1324            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1325            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1326            + "uniform float u_timeOfDay;\n"
1327            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1328            + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
1329            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1330            + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
1331            + "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n"
1332            + "\n"
1333            + "void main()\n"
1334            + "{\n"
1335            + "   float st = sin(1.5707963 * sin(0.2617994 * u_timeOfDay)); // Whenever st is very high or low... \n"
1336            + "   float ct = sin(1.5707963 * cos(0.2617994 * u_timeOfDay)); // ...ct is close to 0, and vice versa. \n"
1337            + "   float dd = ct * ct; // Positive, small; used for dawn and dusk. \n"
1338            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1339            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1340            + "   vec3 oklab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *"
1341            + "     pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
1342            + "     * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n"
1343            + "   // The next four lines make use of the time-based variables st, ct, and dd. Edit to fit. \n"
1344            + "   v_color.x = clamp(oklab.x + (0.0625 * st), 0.0, 1.0);\n"
1345            + "   v_color.yz = clamp(oklab.yz + vec2(0.0625 * dd + 0.03125 * st, 0.1 * st), -1.0, 1.0) * ((dd + 0.25) * 0.5);\n"
1346            + "   v_tweak = vec4(0.2 * st + 0.5);\n"
1347            + "   v_tweak.w = pow((1.0 - 0.125 * st), 1.709);\n"
1348            + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
1349            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1350            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1351            + "}\n";
1352    /**
1353     * The fragment shader counterpart to {@link #vertexShaderDayNight}; must be used with that vertex shader. See its
1354     * docs for more info, particularly about the one uniform this needs set. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1355     * <br>
1356     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1357     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1358     * <br>
1359     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShaderDayNight}.
1360     */
1361    public static String fragmentShaderDayNight =
1362            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1363                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1364                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1365                    "#else\n" +
1366                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1367                    "#endif\n" +
1368                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1369                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1370                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
1371                    "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
1372                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1373                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1374                    "void main()\n" +
1375                    "{\n" +
1376                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1377                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1378                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1379                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1380                    "  lab.x = clamp(pow(lab.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.x + v_color.x - 1.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1381                    "  lab.yz = clamp((lab.yz * v_tweak.yz + v_color.yz) * 1.5, -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1382                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1383                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1384                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1385                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1386                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1387                    "}";
1388
1389    /**
1390     * Takes a batch color in CIE LAB format (but ranging from 0 to 1 instead of its normal larger range).
1391     * Adapted from <a href="https://www.shadertoy.com/view/lsdGzN">This ShaderToy by nmz</a>.
1392     * <br>
1393     * You can generate CIELAB colors using any of various methods in the {@code cielab} package, such as
1394     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab.ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)}.
1395     * <br>
1396     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1397     */
1398    public static String fragmentShaderCielab =
1399            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1400            "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1401            "precision mediump float;\n" +
1402            "#else\n" +
1403            "#define LOWP \n" +
1404            "#endif\n" +
1405            "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1406            "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1407            "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1408            "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1409            "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1410            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1411            "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1412            "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1413            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
1414            "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1415            "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1416            "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, 0.00885645)); }\n" +
1417            "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1418            "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1419            "vec3 rgb2lab(vec3 c)\n" +
1420            "{\n" +
1421            "    c *= mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
1422            "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
1423            "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
1424            "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
1425            "    vec3 lab = vec3(max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16), (c.x - c.y) * 5.0, (c.y - c.z) * 2.0); \n" +
1426            "    return lab;\n" +
1427//            "    return vec3(lab.x, length(vec2(lab.y,lab.z)), atan(lab.z, lab.y));\n" +
1428            "}\n" +
1429            "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1430            "{\n" +
1431//            "    c = vec3(c.x, cos(c.z) * c.y, sin(c.z) * c.y);\n" +
1432            "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
1433            "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
1434            "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
1435            "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
1436            "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
1437            "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
1438            "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
1439            "    return rgb;\n" +
1440            "}\n" +
1441            "void main()\n" +
1442            "{\n" +
1443            "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1444            "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1445            "  lab.x = lab.x + v_color.r - 0.5372549;\n" +
1446            "  lab.yz = lab.yz + (v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
1447            "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1448            "}";
1449
1450    /**
1451     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1452     * batch color, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the batch color, and can be
1453     * gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. This uses an RGB batch color for simpler usage in most code that
1454     * doesn't already use colorful-gdx. There can be some contribution from the original texture, so even if the batch
1455     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1456     * <br>
1457     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1458     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1459     * <br>
1460     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1461     */
1462    public static String fragmentShaderColorize =
1463            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1464                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1465                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1466                    "#else\n" +
1467                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1468                    "#endif\n" +
1469                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1470                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1471                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1472                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1473                    "void main()\n" +
1474                    "{\n" +
1475                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1476                    "//// Ugly repeated matrix math to convert from RGB to Oklab. Oklab keeps lightness separate from hue and saturation.\n" +
1477                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1478                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1479                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1480                    "  vec3 tint = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1481                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1482                    "              * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n" +
1483                    "//// Sharply increases lightness contrast, to counteract the gray-ing caused by averaging base and tint lightness.\n" +
1484                    "  tint.x = (tint.x + base.x) - 1.0;\n" +
1485                    "  tint.x = sign(tint.x) * pow(abs(tint.x), 0.7) * 0.5 + 0.5;\n" +
1486                    "//// Uncomment these next 3 lines if you want the original image to contribute some color, if it has any.\n" +
1487                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1488                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1489                    "  tint.yz = clamp(tint.yz * (0.7 + blen) + base.yz * (0.3 - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1490                    "//// Reverse the Oklab conversion to get back to RGB. Uses the batch color's alpha normally.\n" +
1491                    "  tint = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * tint;\n" +
1492                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1493                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1494                    "                 (tint * tint * tint)," +
1495                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1496                    "}";
1497
1498    /**
1499     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1500     * batch color's chromatic channels, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the
1501     * batch color, and can be gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. The lightness of the batch color is used
1502     * to determine how strong the effect should be; you may want to use an out-of-gamut color for very strong tint
1503     * effects, because those need to be light and the lightest gamut is just one point. This uses an Oklab batch color.
1504     * There is some contribution from the original texture, varied based on the batch lightness, so even if the batch
1505     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1506     * <br>
1507     * You can generate Oklab colors using any of various methods in the {@code oklab} package, such as
1508     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)}.
1509     * <br>
1510     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1511     */
1512    public static String fragmentShaderColorizeOklab =
1513            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1514                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1515                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1516                    "#else\n" +
1517                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1518                    "#endif\n" +
1519                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1520                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1521                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1522                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1523                    "void main()\n" +
1524                    "{\n" +
1525                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1526                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1527                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1528                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1529                    "  vec2 tint = v_color.gb - 0.5;\n" +
1530                    "  base.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1531                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1532                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1533                    "  base.gb = clamp(tint * (v_color.r + blen) + base.yz * (1.0 - v_color.r - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1534                    "  base = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * base;\n" +
1535                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1536                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1537                    "                 (base * base * base)," +
1538                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1539                    "}";
1540    /**
1541     * The simplest possible color-inverting shader for a SpriteBatch, this just takes each RGB channel and subtracts it
1542     * from 1.0 to get the value this uses. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1543     * <br>
1544     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1545     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1546     * <br>
1547     * Meant only for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1548     */
1549    public static final String fragmentShaderInvertedRGB =
1550            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1551                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1552                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1553                    "#else\n" +
1554                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1555                    "#endif\n" +
1556                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1557                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1558                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1559                    "void main()\n" +
1560                    "{\n" +
1561                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1562                    "   gl_FragColor = vec4(1.0 - tgt.rgb * v_color.rgb, v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1563                    "}";
1564
1565    /**
1566     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedRGB}, but internally converts to Oklab, so it can invert just lightness
1567     * without changing color hue or saturation. This uses an RGBA batch color.
1568     * <br>
1569     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1570     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1571     * <br>
1572     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1573     */
1574    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedLightness =
1575            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1576                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1577                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1578                    "#else\n" +
1579                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1580                    "#endif\n" +
1581                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1582                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1583                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1584                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1585                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1586                    "        const float shape = 0.64516133, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1587                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1588                    "        float r = mix(\n" +
1589                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1590                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-3 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1591                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1592                    "        return r * r;\n" +
1593                    "}\n" +
1594                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1595                    "        const float shape = 1.55, turning = 0.95;\n" +
1596                    "        L = sqrt(L);\n" +
1597                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1598                    "        return mix(\n" +
1599                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1600                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-3 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1601                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1602                    "}\n" +
1603//                    "float toOklab(float L) {\n" +
1604//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 - L * 0.4285714) + 1.0;\n" +
1605//                    "}\n" +
1606//                    "float fromOklab(float L) {\n" +
1607//                    "  return (L - 1.0) / (1.0 + L * 0.75) + 1.0;\n" +
1608//                    "}\n" +
1609                    "void main()\n" +
1610                    "{\n" +
1611                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1612                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1613                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1614                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1615                    "  lab.x = fromOklab(1.0 - toOklab(lab.x));\n" +
1616                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1617                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1618                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1619                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1620                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1621                    "}";
1622
1623    /**
1624     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedLightness}, but instead of inverting lightness, this tries to change only
1625     * hue, without changing lightness or (generally) saturation. This works internally by negating the A and B
1626     * components of the color (as Oklab). This uses an RGBA batch color.
1627     * <br>
1628     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1629     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1630     * <br>
1631     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1632     */
1633    public static String fragmentShaderInvertedChroma =
1634            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1635                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1636                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1637                    "#else\n" +
1638                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1639                    "#endif\n" +
1640                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1641                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1642                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1643                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1644                    "void main()\n" +
1645                    "{\n" +
1646                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1647                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1648                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1649                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1650                    "  lab.yz = -lab.yz;\n" +
1651                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1652                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1653                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1654                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1655                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1656                    "}";
1657
1658    /**
1659     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderInvertedChroma}, but instead of inverting chroma, this tries to significantly
1660     * increase the saturation of a color (by pushing chroma away from gray). This works internally by multiplying the A
1661     * and B components of the color (as Oklab) by 2.0 . This uses an RGBA batch color.
1662     * <br>
1663     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1664     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1665     * <br>
1666     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1667     */
1668    public static String fragmentShaderDoubleSaturation =
1669            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1670                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1671                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1672                    "#else\n" +
1673                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1674                    "#endif\n" +
1675                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1676                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1677                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1678                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1679                    "void main()\n" +
1680                    "{\n" +
1681                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords ) * v_color;\n" +
1682                    "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1683                    "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1684                    "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1685                    "  lab.yz *=   2.000  ;\n" +
1686                    "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n" +
1687                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1688                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1689                    "                 (lab * lab * lab)," +
1690                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), tgt.a);\n" +
1691                    "}";
1692
1693    /**
1694     * Prepares and returns a new SpriteBatch that uses {@link #vertexShader} and {@link #fragmentShaderDoubleSaturation}
1695     * from this class, making it able to render RGBA colors from the libGDX or the rgb package. This also takes a
1696     * {@code saturationMultiplier} parameter, which modifies the saturation in the fragment shader so it doesn't have
1697     * to always double the saturation, and can change it by more or less. If greater than 1.0, saturationMultiplier
1698     * will make colors more saturated/rich/vivid, while if it is less than 1.0 it will make all colors closer to gray.
1699     * Using 0.0 will make all colors grayscale.
1700     * <br>
1701     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1702     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1703     *
1704     * @param saturationMultiplier what to multiply the saturation by; 1.0 will have no change, 0.5 desaturates, 2.0 over-saturates
1705     * @return a freshly allocated SpriteBatch that will also have a new ShaderProgram for rendering RGB with contrast
1706     */
1707    public static SpriteBatch makeSaturatingBatch(final float saturationMultiplier)
1708    {
1709        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShaderDoubleSaturation.replace("  2.000  ", Float.toString(saturationMultiplier)));
1710        if(!shader.isCompiled())
1711            throw new GdxRuntimeException("Couldn't compile shader: " + shader.getLog());
1712        return new SpriteBatch(1000, shader);
1713    }
1714
1715    /**
1716     * This is similar to the default vertex shader from libGDX, but also does some expensive setup work for HSLuv batch
1717     * colors per-vertex instead of per-fragment. It is needed if you use {@link #fragmentShaderHsluv}.
1718     */
1719    public static final String vertexShaderHsluv =
1720            "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1721            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1722            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1723            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
1724            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
1725            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
1726            +
1727            "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1728            "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1729            "const mat3 m =" +
1730            "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1731            "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1732            "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1733            "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1734            "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1735            "}\n" +
1736            "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1737            "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1738            "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1739            "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1740            "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1741            "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1742            "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1743            "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1744            "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1745            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1746            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1747            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1748            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1749            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1750            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1751            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1752            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1753            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1754            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1755            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1756            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1757            "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1758            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1759            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1760            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1761            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1762            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1763            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1764            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1765            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1766            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1767            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1768            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1769            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1770            "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1771            "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1772            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1773            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1774            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1775            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1776            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1777            "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1778            "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1779            "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1780            "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1781            "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1782            "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1783            "        return mn;\n" +
1784            "}\n" +
1785            "vec3 hsl2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1786            "{\n" +
1787            "    float L = c.z;\n" +
1788            "    float C = chromaLimit(c.x, L) * c.y;\n" +
1789            "    float U = cos(c.x) * C;\n" +
1790            "    float V = sin(c.x) * C;\n" +
1791            "    return vec3(L, U, V);\n" +
1792            "}\n"
1793            + "void main()\n"
1794            + "{\n"
1795            + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1796            + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
1797            + "   v_color.x *= 6.2831;\n"
1798            + "   v_color.rgb = hsl2luv(v_color.rgb);\n"
1799            + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
1800            + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
1801            + "}\n";
1802
1803    /**
1804     * Just like {@link #fragmentShaderOklab}, but uses the HSLuv color space instead of the Oklab one.
1805     * This also gamma-corrects the inputs and outputs, though it uses subtly different math internally.
1806     * <br>
1807     * You can generate HSLuv colors using any of various methods in the {@code hsluv} package, such as
1808     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv.ColorTools#hsluv(float, float, float, float)}.
1809     * <br>
1810     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShaderHsluv}.
1811     */
1812    public static String fragmentShaderHsluv =
1813            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1814                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1815                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1816                    "#else\n" +
1817                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1818                    "#endif\n" +
1819                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1820                    "varying vec4 v_color;\n" +
1821                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1822                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1823                    "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
1824                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
1825                    "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
1826                    "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
1827                    "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
1828                    "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
1829                    "const vec2 refUV = vec2(0.19783000664283681, 0.468319994938791);\n" +
1830                    "const mat3 m =" +
1831                    "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
1832                    "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
1833                    "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
1834                    "const mat3 mInv =\n" +
1835                    "         mat3(0.41239079926595948 , 0.35758433938387796, 0.180480788401834290,\n" +
1836                    "              0.21263900587151036 , 0.71516867876775593, 0.072192315360733715,\n" +
1837                    "              0.019330818715591851, 0.11919477979462599, 0.950532152249660580);\n" +
1838                    "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
1839                    "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
1840                    "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon.x)); }\n" +
1841                    "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
1842                    "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
1843                    "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
1844                    "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
1845                    "}\n" +
1846                    "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
1847                    "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
1848                    "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
1849                    "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1850                    "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
1851                    "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
1852                    "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
1853                    "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
1854                    "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
1855                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1856                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1857                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1858                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1859                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1860                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1861                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1862                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1863                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1864                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1865                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1866                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1867                    "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
1868                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1869                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1870                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1871                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1872                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1873                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1874                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1875                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1876                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1877                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1878                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1879                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1880                    "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
1881                    "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
1882                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1883                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1884                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1885                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1886                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1887                    "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
1888                    "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
1889                    "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
1890                    "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
1891                    "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
1892                    "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
1893                    "        return mn;\n" +
1894                    "}\n" +
1895                    "vec3 rgb2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
1896                    "{\n" +
1897                    "    c *= mInv;" +
1898                    "    float L = max(0.,1.16*pow(c.y, 1.0 / 3.0) - 0.16);\n" +
1899                    "    vec2 uv;\n" +
1900                    "    if(L < 0.0001) uv = vec2(0.0);\n" +
1901                    "    else uv = 13. * L * (vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) - refUV);\n" +
1902                    "    return vec3(L, uv);\n" +
1903                    "}\n" +
1904                    "float forwardLight(float L) {\n" +
1905                    "        const float shape = 0.8528, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1906                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1907                    "        return mix(\n" +
1908                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1909                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-3 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1910                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1911                    "}\n" +
1912                    "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
1913                    "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
1914                    "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
1915                    "        return mix(\n" +
1916                    "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
1917                    "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-3 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
1918                    "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
1919                    "}\n" +
1920                    "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
1921                    "{\n" +
1922                    "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
1923                    "    float U = c.y;\n" +
1924                    "    float V = c.z;\n" +
1925                    "    float lim = chromaLimit(atan(V, U), L);\n" +
1926                    "    float len = length(vec2(U,V));\n" +
1927                    "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
1928                    "      lim /= len;\n" +
1929                    "      U *= lim;\n" +
1930                    "      V *= lim;\n" +
1931                    "    }\n" +
1932                    "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
1933                    "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
1934                    "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
1935                    "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
1936                    "    } else {\n" +
1937                    "      if (L <= 0.08) {\n" +
1938                    "        c.y = L / kappa;\n" +
1939                    "      } else {\n" +
1940                    "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
1941                    "        c.y *= c.y * c.y;\n" +
1942                    "      }\n" +
1943                    "    }\n" +
1944                    "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
1945                    "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
1946                    "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
1947                    "    c.x = 2.25 * varU * c.y / varV;\n" +
1948                    "    c.z = (3. / varV - 5.) * c.y - (c.x / 3.);\n" +
1949                    "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
1950                    "    return rgb;\n" +
1951                    "}\n" +
1952                    "void main()\n" +
1953                    "{\n" +
1954                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1955                    "  vec3 luv = rgb2luv(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1956                    "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(luv.x + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
1957                    "  luv.yz = (luv.yz) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
1958                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1959                    "}";
1960
1961    /**
1962     * A simple shader that renders just like SpriteBatch's default shader, except that when it would draw white, it
1963     * instead draws red (which can be replaced in the shader code with a custom color, as with
1964     * {@link #makeSwappingBatch(float, float, float)}).
1965     * <br>
1966     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1967     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}, or just by using normal
1968     * SpriteBatch and Color methods.
1969     * <br>
1970     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1971     */
1972    public static final String fragmentShaderSwapWhite =
1973            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1974                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1975                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1976                    "#else\n" +
1977                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1978                    "#endif\n" +
1979                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1980                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1981                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1982                    "void main()\n" +
1983                    "{\n" +
1984                    "   vec4 tgt = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" +
1985                    "   if(tgt.r + tgt.g + tgt.b == 3.0)\n" + // color of the pixel in the Texture must be white
1986                    "     gl_FragColor = vec4(   1.00, 0.00, 0.00   , tgt.a) * v_color;\n" +
1987                    "   else\n" +
1988                    "     gl_FragColor = tgt * v_color;\n" +
1989                    "}";
1990
1991    /**
1992     * Prepares and returns a new SpriteBatch that uses {@link #vertexShader} and {@link #fragmentShaderSwapWhite}
1993     * from this class, making it able to render RGBA colors from libGDX or the rgb package. This also takes red, green,
1994     * and blue parameters, each between 0.0 and 1.0, which define the color that white will be replaced with.
1995     * <br>
1996     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1997     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}, or just by using normal
1998     * SpriteBatch and Color methods.
1999     *
2000     * @param red   between 0.0 and 1.0, the red value of the color to replace white with.
2001     * @param green between 0.0 and 1.0, the green value of the color to replace white with.
2002     * @param blue  between 0.0 and 1.0, the blue value of the color to replace white with.
2003     * @return a freshly allocated SpriteBatch that will also have a new ShaderProgram for rendering RGB with contrast
2004     */
2005    public static SpriteBatch makeSwappingBatch(final float red, final float green, final float blue)
2006    {
2007        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShaderSwapWhite.replace("   1.00, 0.00, 0.00   ", red + ", " + green + ", " + blue));
2008        if(!shader.isCompiled())
2009            throw new GdxRuntimeException("Couldn't compile shader: " + shader.getLog());
2010        return new SpriteBatch(1000, shader);
2011    }
2012
2013}
